availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin F. Wash (Anderson County, Kentucky, teacher.)

body.p: Anderson County, Kentucky, teacher. Kentucky native. Son of John Wash and Rebecca Wash. Laborer in Anderson County in 1850. School teacher in Anderson County in 1860. Served as a private in the 54th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) from February 18, 1865 to September 1, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson, p. 496; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson, p. 552;
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0463.
